comment: Very hard to figure out what she wants. I felt like I was failing half the semester, slow grader and you have no idea what is graded and what isn't.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Mrs. Lawrence is not a very great teacher. the class itself is pretty easy but she is not tech savvy, not very nice, and often times I dont understand what exactly she wants us to do for our assignments. meh.

The only issue I had with Dr. Lawrence was her struggle with technology. Our last assignment included an anonymous survey, and because names were not provided, all students received zeros. She also never answered emails about the situation. However, her lessons were interesting and helpful. Be expected to get called out and participate.

The content for this class is very simple. But, she is very slow about responding to emails and putting in grades. I had only 2 grades in before final grades were due including 4 summative assignments still not graded. Therefore, there is no way to fix your mistakes or learn from them to improve because she doesn't grade until the last minute.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class had some good content that could have been made enjoyable. Professor never pronounced a name right the whole semester. She was late to class and unprepared. Emailed assignments at 9pm due the next day. Little direction and harsh (late) grading. Disrespectful of our time. Lacks professionalism. Ruined my Junior year 4.0 GPA.

she's okay. none of my grades were in until finals week, which was a bit annoying. the lectures are really monotone and business-y, but the content of them is good. my classmates and the discussion were what made the class for me. unfortunately you cannot miss any days or it hurts your grade.

She would grade everything late and give you a low grade with very feeble feedback on why you got that grade. For a seminar-based class it was very monotone and boring. I seriously considered dropping out of the honors program because of this teacher. She wasn't helpful when you asked her questions about assignments. Get a different teacher.

This professor took the weeks to grade most of her assignments but if you miss 2 classes you fail her course. Everything she assigned required a ridiculous amount of reading just for her to give you a B and unspecific feedback. Her major assignment (37% of grade) had no resources to help students. Everything she did made this class miserable.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Lawrence is by far the worst professor I have ever had. She would not grade your homework, instead she just gives you between an 80-87 and copy and pasted the same response for why you received the grade. DO NOT take her honors class. Most of the people in the class I was in said that they were going to drop honors just because of her.
Easily the worst professor I had in my 1st semester. The work I turned in wasn't graded for months, and good feedback was not given. The class was easy, but it was a miserable experience.

All grades would be put in the last few days before the grades were reported.  This made it hard to figure out exactly what she was looking for, and instead she would take off points for unknown reasons and copy and paste a generalized response in the feedback.  Waste the headache and the need to retake the course.

brought no enthusiasm to this class and always lectured in a very monotone voice. Read her lectures off of a paper so falling asleep in this class would be very easy. Grades everything during finals week so we have no clue if we should be doing better on our writing prompts. This class felt like a waste of my time. Do not recommend.

Please consider another professor. She made me want to quit the honors program. She takes months to grade assignments and respond to emails. Her D2L is  unorganized and she expects you to be able to understand it. Her lectures were extremely boring and not helpful, as all she did was read straight off the board with no engagement with students.

Do not take this teacher!! We were told this class was meant to be "an easy A" just to introduce us to the Honors College.. it was not with this teacher. She grades harshly and based on things she never asked for when it was due. Never answers emails.. painfully boring.. grades at the last minute, giving you zero time to ask how to fix mistakes!!

At first, I would have rated Professor Lawrence higher, until I learned about my final grades. Apparently, I got marked off on event attendance for not including specific details. She did not specify this, nor did she put those specifications in D2L. She is also horrible with emails. Take Professor Ellwanger instead as his lectures are much better.

The most boring class I have every taken. The content is all common sense so an hour of mandatory silence is rough. Lots of watching ted Talks or PowerPoints. Professor Lawrence does nothing to fluff the material she reads it monotone back to you. Hard to stay awake in class if you fall asleep easily.

A lot of what I have to complain about with Hon 1100 is the common-sense content. Professor Lawrence didn't bring a lot of excitement to the lectures and she steered the conversations in a way I didn't love. She did give me partial credit for something after saying she wouldn't though, so I would reccomending participating in discussions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: It was not Professor Lawrence's fault I got a B, I just simply could not stand going to class and attendance is very important for your grade. This class made me really regret applying for the honors program to be honest. The class is just filled with awkward participation.

The class is just so boring to be honest but Dr. Lawrence is a pretty nice lady. Luckily the class is literally just participation and like 2 projects that arent even hard and she isnt a very tough grader.

Since this class was seven weeks, we had long class sessions where she would have to stretch the content for the day so that it fits a two-hour timeslot. This made the class so boring, and the content taught was common sense. The way she grades projects is super strict. She gave me a 93 for not having all info in the CONCLUSION of the project.

Professor Lawrence herself is a nice lady. My main issues come from the fact that it felt like a serious waste of my time to attend class. It felt like I could have read the slides at home in a fraction of the time as there was no additional input given. The lecture was just professor Lawrence reading off the slides word for word.

I can not tell if she likes being a teacher. All her classes told us to read the board instead of presenting things. She was never clear about how our assignments would be graded, adding things in at the last second. Anytime I would try and email her outside of class, it was a toss-up if she would respond. If you have her for honors I'm so sorry.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a nice lady and very approachable in class. But, it takes her an unusually long time to respond to emails (hard to reach outside of class). Not a harsh grader. Takes attendance every class and has category for class participation. This could be the same thing for all Honors Intro teachers, but never told us about HW.
